{
  "article_text": [
    "many interesting phenomena have been observed in bose gases with feshbach resonances",
    ". enormous particle - loss rate due to three - body recombination was found near the resonance @xcite .",
    "oscillations between atoms and diatomic feshbach molecules were generated by a sudden change in magnetic field @xcite .",
    "large number of feshbach molecules were produced from bose gases either by tuning the magnetic field through the resonance @xcite or by oscillating the magnetic field at a frequency corresponding to the molecular binding energy @xcite .",
    "even tetramer molecules were created from feshbach molecules @xcite .",
    "however bec of feshbach molecules in bose gases has not been achieved in experiments so far and properties of this state are waiting to be explored .",
    "properties of atomic - bec state have been extensively studied theoretically @xcite .",
    "phase transition between atomic and molecular bec was proposed near the resonance @xcite .",
    "however these phases suffer mechanical collapse in regions with negative scattering length @xmath1 @xcite .",
    "a recent work @xcite shows that the molecular - bec state of a bose gas with a wide feshbach resonance at zero temperature exists only when the atom density @xmath2 satisfies @xmath3 for positive scattering length @xmath4 .    in this paper , the molecular - bec state of a homogeneous bose gas with a wide feshbach resonance",
    "is studied at finite temperatures . in the following ,",
    "we first describe the molecular - bec state in a mean - field approach where the hatree - fock energy and pairing gap are determined self - consistently .",
    "long - wavelength excitations and molecular binding energy are obtained .",
    "then mechanically stability of the molecular - bec state is examined across the resonance , and the mean - field phase diagram is obtained .",
    "coherent mixture of atomic and molecular bec is also studied .",
    "discussion and conclusion are given in the end .",
    "in alkali - atom gases with feshbach resonances , scattering states in the open channel and bound states in the closed channel are coupled together . near a wide resonance ,",
    "the effective range of the interaction is very small , and most atoms are in the open channel @xcite .",
    "a uniform bose gas with a wide feshbach resonance can be effectively described by a single - channel model , @xmath5 where @xmath6 is the field operator of bose atoms in the open channel , the coupling constant is given by @xmath7 , and @xmath8 is the chemical potential of atoms .    in the molecular - bec state ,",
    "atoms are paired into molecules and the off - diagonal long range order ( odlro ) appears , @xmath9 . without losing any generality ,",
    "@xmath10 is assumed in the following . in the mean field , in addition to the pairing energy , both hartree and fock energies",
    "should be taken into account , and the mean - field hamiltonian density is given by @xmath11 where the constant @xmath12 is given by @xmath13 . in this mean - field approximation ,",
    "the pairing gap @xmath14 and hartree - fock energy are determined self - consistently , but the fluctuation and three - body effects are ignored .",
    "the mean - field theory provides a description about single - particle excitations , but it is incapable to describe collective excitations or few - body properties such as effimov effect .",
    "nonetheless , the mean - field approximation can serve as a starting point of the theoretical description for the molecular - bec state .",
    "the mean - field hamiltonian can be diagonalized by bogoliubov transformation , @xmath15 where @xmath16 is the annihilation operator of atomic quasi - particles , @xmath17 is the quasi - particle energy , and the transformation coefficients are given by @xmath18/2 $ ] with @xmath19 and @xmath20 .",
    "the energy constant @xmath21 is given by @xmath22-gn^2 v ,   \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath23 and @xmath24 is the volume .",
    "the order parameter @xmath14 can be determined self - consistently , @xmath25 , \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath26 is the bose distribution function of quasi - particles , @xmath27 $ ] .",
    "this self - consistency equation can be written explicitly as @xmath28,\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where the term @xmath29 in the integrand on the right - hand side is a counter term due to vacuum renormalization .",
    "the chemical potential @xmath8 and the order parameter @xmath14 can be solved from eq .",
    "( [ gapeq ] ) and the following equation for the density @xmath2 , @xmath30 \\nonumber \\\\ & = \\int \\frac{\\mathrm{d}^3k}{(2\\pi)^3}\\left [ \\frac{\\epsilon_k-\\mu'}{2e_k}\\coth \\left({\\beta e_k\\over2}\\right)-{1\\over 2}\\right].\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]      there is a gap in the atomic excitation energy given by @xmath31 if the molecular - bec state is stable , one necessary condition is that the gap @xmath32 is real , or @xmath33 . when @xmath34 , the atomic excitation becomes gapless , @xmath35 , which marks the lower boundary of the molecular - bec phase .",
    "the upper phase boundary is located at the superfluid transition temperature @xmath36 where @xmath37 and @xmath38 .",
    "in addition to atomic excitations , there are collective excitations of feshbach molecules .",
    "although the molecular excitation energy can not be obtained in the mean - field approximation , it can be extracted from poles of two - particle correlation functions given by @xmath39 \\rangle,\\ ] ] where @xmath40 , @xmath41 , @xmath42 , @xmath43 , and @xmath44 is the time - ordering operator . as in the zero - temperature case @xcite",
    ", the correlation function can be calculated in the random - phase approximation ( rpa ) , @xmath45^{-1 } \\chi^{(0)}({\\bf k},\\omega),\\ ] ] where @xmath46 is the correlation function calculated in the mean - field approximation . in rpa",
    ", the dispersion of feshbach molecules satisfies the following equation , @xmath47 where @xmath48 is the identity matrix .",
    "the molecular excitation is gapless in the long - wavelength limit , @xmath49 and @xmath50 , following eq .",
    "( [ gapeq ] ) . at small @xmath51 and @xmath52 , to the leading order of @xmath51 , the molecular excitation frequency",
    "is linearly dispersed .",
    "the detail of molecular excitations will be studied in our future work .       and @xmath53k .",
    "the dotted line is the binding energy in vacuum , @xmath54 .",
    "the inset shows the temperature dependence of the binding energy for different @xmath55.,width=302 ]    the binding energy @xmath56 of a feshbach molecule in the molecular - bec state is defined as the energy difference between two atomic and one molecular excitations at @xmath49 . since the molecular excitation energy is gapless in the molecular - bec state , the binding energy of feshbach molecules is twice the energy gap of atomic excitations , @xmath57 . due to many - body effect , the binding energy @xmath56 is different from its vacuum value @xmath58 . at the superfluid transition temperature @xmath36 ,",
    "the binding energy is given by @xmath59 . in the limit of weakly - attractive interaction , @xmath60 , we obtain @xmath61 where @xmath62 is the riemann - zeta function and @xmath63 is the ideal bec temperature , @xmath64^{2/3}$ ] ; in the limit of weakly repulsion , @xmath65 , the binding energy is same as in vacuum , @xmath66",
    ".    at finite temperatures , molecules not only exist for @xmath4 , but also appear as loosely - bound pairs for @xmath1 in the mean - field theory , whereas in vacuum feshbach molecules exist only for @xmath4 .",
    "however at zero temperature , the molecular - bec state exist only when @xmath67 @xcite . in fig .",
    "[ bind - energy ] , the molecular binding energy in the mean - field approximation is plotted at both @xmath68 and @xmath53 , in comparison with its vacuum value .",
    "the temperature dependence of the binding energy for different scattering lengths is shown in the inset .",
    "for @xmath69 , the binding energy decreases monotonically with temperature , all the way to zero at the lower boundary of the molecular - bec phase ; for @xmath67 , the binding energy decreases monotonically to a finite value at zero temperature . in the dilute limit ,",
    "@xmath70 , the temperature dependence of the binding energy is weak , and the binding energy is approximately given by vacuum value @xmath71 .",
    "a mechanically stable bose gas has positive compressibility , indicated by @xmath72 . in the normal state ,",
    "a bose gas with @xmath1 collapses when @xmath73 . in the hartree - fock approximation",
    ", this condition can be rewritten as @xmath74 the collapse temperature @xmath75 is always higher than the molecular bec transition temperature @xmath36 @xcite . in the limit of weakly - attractive interaction , @xmath60 ,",
    "the collapse temperature @xmath75 approaches to the ideal atomic bec temperature @xmath63 , @xmath76.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] in contrast , a normal bose gas with @xmath4 is always mechanically stable .     versus @xmath77 .",
    "the solid line is the chemical potential in the molecular - bec ( mbec ) state and the dotted line is the chemical potential in the normal state , ( a ) with attractive interaction , @xmath1 ; ( b ) with repulsive interaction , @xmath4 .",
    "the lines with @xmath780.5 , 0.7 , 1.0 , and 1.3 , are plotted , where @xmath79 is the thermal de broglie wavelength.,width=283 ]    we examine the compressibility of the molecular - bec state numerically following eq .",
    "( [ gapeq ] ) and ( [ deneq ] ) . in fig .",
    "[ compress - pair ] , the chemical potential @xmath8 is plotted as a function of density @xmath2 at given temperatures and scattering lengths . for @xmath1 ,",
    "the chemical potential @xmath8 is monotonically decreasing with the increase of @xmath2 , @xmath80 , showing that the system is mechanically unstable as found in previous studies @xcite .",
    "for @xmath4 , the compressibility is always positive , @xmath81 , and the molecular - bec state is mechanically stable .",
    "therefore , in a uniform bose gas , the molecular - bec state can only exist with positive scattering lengths , @xmath4 . in a trap",
    ", the molecular - bec state may be stabilized by the finite - size effect , similar to trapped bec with attractive interactions @xcite .",
    "the upper boundary of the molecular - bec phase is determined by the disappearance of order parameter @xmath37 , corresponding to the second - order phase transition between the normal and molecular - bec phases . at the transition temperature @xmath36 ,",
    "( [ gapeq ] ) is the same as the thouless criterion which marks the pairing instability of the normal phase , @xmath82.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] the density equation ( [ deneq ] ) at @xmath36 becomes the hartree - fock self - consistency condition of the normal bose gas @xmath83    in the limit of the weakly - attractive interaction , @xmath84 , the transition temperature @xmath36 is close to the ideal atomic bec temperature @xmath85^{2/3}$ ] , @xmath86,\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] as found in a previous study @xcite .    in the opposite limit , @xmath65",
    ", molecules are tightly bound with the binding energy approximately given by @xmath71 . from eq .",
    "( [ thouless ] ) , the chemical potential is approximately given by @xmath87 .",
    "the solution of density equation ( [ density - tp ] ) yields @xmath88 which is essentially the same as the mean - field result about the bec limit of a fermi gas with a bec - bcs crossover .",
    "as pointed out in earlier works @xcite , the divergent mean - field transition temperature in this limit in fact corresponds to the temperature of molecule dissociation , not molecular condensation .",
    "the transition temperature @xmath36 can be renormalized by pairing fluctuations @xcite .",
    "the lower boundary of the molecular - bec phase is determined by @xmath89 , where the excitation energy becomes gapless , @xmath90 . at zero temperature , this boundary is located at @xmath91 @xcite .",
    "disappearance of gap in excitation energies was interpreted as appearance of atomic condensation @xcite . however , as discussed later in section iii , a coherent mixture with atoms and molecules is mechanically unstable .",
    "the order parameter @xmath14 in the molecular - bec phase evolves smoothly between two phase boundaries .",
    "based on the above results , the mean - field phase diagram is plotted in fig .",
    "[ phase_diagram ] .",
    "the molecular - bec phase is labeled as p(s ) for @xmath4 and p(c ) for @xmath1 , where symbols ( s ) and ( c ) represent mechanical stability and mechanical collapse .",
    "recently similar phase diagrams were obtained in ref .",
    "@xcite within the approach pioneered by nozires and schmitt - rink ( nsr ) @xcite",
    ". in the nsr approach , pairing fluctuations are treated by the @xmath92-matrix approximation , and the total particle density includes not only the mean - field density , but also the density of thermal molecules . although there are some discrepancies , most features of our mean - field phase diagram fig .",
    "[ phase_diagram ] qualitatively agree with those in ref .",
    "the condensation temperature of the mbec phase is significantly reduced in the nsr approach . in the limit of weakly - repulsive interaction",
    ", it can recover the condensation temperature of an ideal molecular bose gas , @xmath93 .",
    "both nsr and mean - field phase diagrams show that there is a transition from the molecular bec to the mixture state .",
    "as shown in the next section , the mixture state is mechanically unstable in the mean - field approximation . in ref .",
    "@xcite , the normal state was found to be stable in the simple nsr approach , but unstable close to the resonance in the extended nsr approach by taking into account interaction between molecules . in the mean - field approach ,",
    "the normal state is unstable near the resonance only on the attractive - interaction side .",
    "at the lower boundary of the molecular - bec phase , the atomic excitation energy vanishes , @xmath35 , suggesting the appearance of the coherent atom - molecule mixture . in the mixture , since both molecules and atoms exhibit odlro , two order parameters can be introduced @xcite , @xmath94 describing atomic condensate and @xmath95 describing molecular condensate , where @xmath96 .",
    "these two order parameters are in principle independent , whereas in the atomic - bec state @xmath14 is a function of @xmath97 . in the mean - field approximation , the hamiltonian density for this mixture state is given by @xmath98,\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where @xmath99 , @xmath100 is the atomic - condensate density , @xmath101 , and @xmath102 .",
    "the order parameter @xmath97 should minimize the mean - field thermodynamic potential , which leads to the saddle point condition @xmath103 to satisfy the saddle point condition , the product @xmath104 must be real . for simplicity , we choose @xmath105 .",
    "as in the molecular bec case , the mean - field hamiltonian of the mixture can be diagonalized by bogoliubov transformation , where the field operator of atomic quasi - particles is given by @xmath106 , @xmath107/2 $ ] , and the quasi - particle energy is given by @xmath108 .",
    "the order parameter @xmath14 can be determined by the self - consistency equation @xmath109 , \\nonumber\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] i.e. @xmath110,\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] where similar to eq .",
    "( [ gapeq ] ) the last term in the integrand is the counter term .",
    "the equation for the total density is given by @xmath111.\\end{aligned}\\ ] ]    from the saddle point condition eq .",
    "( [ saddlepoint - mixture ] ) , the ratio @xmath112 is either 1 or -1 , and the quasi - particle excitation energy can be rewritten as @xmath113 if the excitation energy @xmath114 is real , two conditions , @xmath115 and @xmath116 , must be true , which can not be satisfied when the scattering length @xmath0 is negative , indicating that the mixture can not exist with @xmath1 . when @xmath117 , there is a transition from the coherent mixture phase to the molecular - bec phase . at zero temperature ,",
    "the transition point between the two phases locates at @xmath118 .    for fixed total density ,",
    "the chemical potential and order parameters can be solved from eq .",
    "( [ saddlepoint - mixture ] , [ gapeq - mixture ] , [ deneq - mixture ] ) .",
    "the solution shows a reentrant behavior near the transition to the molecular - bec phase , as shown in fig .",
    "[ compress - mixture ] .",
    "the reentrance range in temperature is broadened close to the resonance .",
    "this reentrance behavior is likely to be an unphysical result in the mean - field approximation near the transition , similar to that in the popov approximation of a bose gas near the atomic bec temperature @xcite .",
    "away from this reentrance , as shown in fig .",
    "[ compress - mixture ] , the chemical potential @xmath8 is a monotonically decreasing function of density @xmath2 for fixed @xmath119 and @xmath0 , @xmath120 , meaning that compressibility is negative .",
    "therefore the coherent mixture is subject to mechanical collapse .     of the coherent mixture versus @xmath77 with @xmath1210.2 , 0.3 , 0.5 and 1.0",
    "respectively , where @xmath122 .",
    ", width=302 ]",
    "in the mean - field approximation , although the pairing gap and hartree - fock energy are computed self - consistently , fluctuations are ignored . in the nsr approach @xcite ,",
    "the pairing fluctuation is treated , which significantly reduced the condensation temperature .",
    "however , the hartree - fock energy is ignored in the nsr approach , affecting the condition of mechanical stability . in future many - body theories , the self - energy should be determined self - consistently with fluctuations properly treated .",
    "experimentally , three - body recombination causes enormous particle - loss near the resonance . in a more accurate microscopic theory ,",
    "both many - body and few - body effects should be considered .",
    "nonetheless , the mean - field theory provides a basic picture about the strongly interacting bose gas , with most features of the phase diagram in qualitative agreement with the nsr approach @xcite .    in conclusion ,",
    "the molecular - bec state of a homogeneous bose gas with a wide feshbach resonance is studied at finite temperatures . in the long - wavelength limit , the atomic excitation is gapped and molecular excitation is gapless .",
    "the molecular binding energy is changed from its vacuum value due to many - body effect and can even vanish when the scattering length @xmath0 is finite .",
    "when @xmath1 , the compressibility of the molecular bec state is negative and the system is subject to mechanical collapse .",
    "the possibility of coherent atom - molecule mixture is also explored , but the compressibility of the mixture is negative and the mixture is subject to mechanical collapse .",
    "based on these results , a mean - field phase diagram at finite temperatures is obtained .",
    "this work is supported by nsfc under grant no .",
    "10674007 and no . 10974004 , and by chinese most under grant number 2006cb921402 .",

    "c. a. r. s de melo , m. randeria , and j. r. engelbrecht , phys .",
    "* 71 * , 3202 ( 1993 ) .",
    "a. koetsier , p. massignan , r. a. duine , and h. t. c. stoof , phys .",
    "a * 79 * , 063609 ( 2009 ) .",
    "p. nozires and s. schmitt - rink , j. low temp .",
    "phys . * 59 * , 195 ( 1985 ) .",
    "j. o. andersen , rev .",
    "* 76 * , 599 ( 2004 ) ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> bose - einstein condensation ( bec ) of feshbach molecules in a homogeneous bose gas is studied at finite temperatures in a single - channel mean - field approach where the hartree - fock energy and pairing gap are determined self - consistently . in the molecular - bec state , </S>",
    "<S> the atomic excitation is gapped and the molecular excitation is gapless . </S>",
    "<S> the binding energy of feshbach molecules is shifted from the vacuum value due to many - body effect . </S>",
    "<S> when the scattering length @xmath0 of atoms is negative , the system is subject to mechanical collapse due to negative compressibility . </S>",
    "<S> the system is stable in most regions with positive scattering lengths . </S>",
    "<S> however at low temperatures near the resonance , the molecular - bec state vanishes , and the coherent mixture of atomic and molecular bec is subject to mechanical collapse . </S>"
  ]
}
